More Information

The list of covered drugs was last updated on <mm.dd.yyyy.>.

The Formulary may change at any time. You will receive notice when necessary.

The drug costs displayed are estimates and may vary based on the specific quantity, strength and/or dosage of the medication and the pharmacy you use.

No drug will move to a higher cost tier unless a new generic version becomes available. If this occurs, you will be notified in your Prescription Drug Explanation of Benefits (EOB) 60 days before the change takes effect.

    Take advantage of a $0 co-pay for Tier 1 and Tier 2 medications and make the most of your pharmacy benefits. Begin using home delivery with OptumRx today.

    You could pay less for the same medication when you use home delivery through OptumRx, your plan's preferred mail service pharmacy.

    Completed orders for a new prescription should arrive within ten business days, completed refill orders should arrive in about seven business days. No charge for standard delivery to U.S. addresses, including U.S. territories. Pharmacists are available by phone to answer your questions any day, anytime.

    Learn more about starting home delivery keyboard_arrow_down

    OptumRx makes it easy to move to move to home delivery. Get started with only a few quick steps. We can even contact your doctor to move your prescription. Begin using home delivery today.

    Go online.

    Set up your account at optumrx.com and select which medication you would like to enroll in home delivery.

    By phone.

    Call OptumRx at 1-888-217-0152 (TTY 711), any day, anytime. OptumRx can get you set up with home delivery right over the phone.

    By mail.

    Complete an order form and mail it with your written prescription(s) to OptumRx. Prescription order form (PDF) (749.8 KB)

More Information

This directory is current as of <the first Sunday of each month>.

All network pharmacies may not be listed in this directory. Inclusion of a pharmacy does not guarantee that the pharmacy is open, is at the same location as listed in this online directory, or is included in the network. The pharmacy network may change at any time. You will receive notice when necessary. Please contact UnitedHealthcare® for details.

Pharmacy Saver Program Drugs and prices may vary between pharmacies and are subject to change during the plan year. Prices are based on quantity filled at the pharmacy. Quantities may be limited by pharmacy based on their dispensing policy or by the plan based on Quantity Limit requirements; if prescription is in excess of a limit, co-pay amounts may be higher.

This information is not a complete description of benefits. Contact the plan for more information. Limitations, co-payments, and restrictions may apply. Benefits, premium and/or co-payment/co-insurance may change on January 1 each year.

Other pharmacies are available in our network. Members may use any pharmacy in the network, but may not receive Pharmacy Saver pricing. Pharmacies participating in the Pharmacy Saver program may not be available in all areas.

You must add at least one drug to see your costs.

You must select a pharmacy to see your costs.

Important Disclaimer Information

The list of covered drugs was last updated on 03.26.2018.

The drug costs displayed are estimates and may vary based on the specific quantity, strength and/or dosage of the medication and the pharmacy you use. It may be important to look beyond your current needs at the value of having Medicare prescription drug insurance. Enrolling when you become eligible may help give you peace of mind, should your drug needs become more significant in the future. It may also help you avoid the Medicare late enrollment penalty.

No drug will move to a higher cost tier unless a new generic version becomes available. If this occurs, you will be notified in your Prescription Drug Explanation of Benefits (EOB) 60 days before the change takes effect.

The Formulary and/or pharmacy directory may change at any time. You will receive notice when necessary.
